Website: https://www.utho.com/ Job Summary: The Process Coordinator plays a crucial role in facilitating effective task management and coordination within an organization. This position involves overseeing tasks, following up with responsible parties, and providing reminders to ensure timely completion. The Process Coordinator acts as a central point of contact for task-related communication, helping to streamline workflows and optimize productivity. Responsibilities: 1. Oversee the assignment and completion of tasks across various departments and teams within the organization. 2. Coordinate task allocation, ensuring that responsibilities are assigned to the appropriate individuals or teams based on skillset, availability, and priority. 3. Follow up with assigned individuals or teams to track task progress, provide updates, and address any obstacles or challenges that may arise. 4. Provide reminder services to ensure that tasks are completed on time, sending notifications and reminders as needed to keep individuals informed and accountable. 5. Maintain accurate records of tasks, including deadlines, status updates, and any relevant notes or comments, using task management software or other tracking tools. 6. Serve as a liaison between task owners, team members, and project managers, facilitating clear and effective communication to ensure that everyone is aligned and informed. 7. Identify and address any issues or bottlenecks that may impede task completion, collaborating with team to find solutions and keep projects on track. 8. Monitor task performance metrics, such as completion rates and turnaround times, to identify trends, measure efficiency, and make recommendations for process improvements. 9. Ensure the quality and accuracy of completed tasks, conducting reviews and audits as needed to uphold standards of excellence and compliance with organizational policies and procedures. Qualifications : Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Project Management, or related field. Proven experience in task coordination, project management, or administrative support roles. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization. Proficiency in task management software, project management tools, or other digital platforms for tracking and monitoring tasks. Attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to delivering high-quality work and exceptional customer service. Problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to identify issues, propose solutions, and implement process improvements. Adaptability and flexibility, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic and evolving work environment How to Apply: Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and interest in the position to HR@UTHO.COM and also call on 9971789543.

column2: - Technology Strategy: Develop and implement technology strategies that align with the overall business objectives and ensure the effective use of technology resources.    - Resource/Procurement Management: Manage the allocation of technology resources, including hardware, software, and personnel, to ensure that they are used efficiently and effectively.    - Project Management: Plan, coordinate, and oversee technology projects, ensuring that they are completed on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of stakeholders.    - Vendor Management: Manage relationships with technology vendors and suppliers, negotiate contracts, and ensure that technology purchases are cost-effective e.g. RKIT, Dell, SB/DV.    - Network and Security: Maintain the integrity, security, and availability of the organization's technology infrastructure and data.    - Staff Management: Supervise and mentor technology staff, including hiring and performance management.    - Budgeting: Develop and manage the technology budget, ensuring that technology investments are aligned with the organization's overall financial objectives.    - Compliance: Ensure that the organization's technology practices comply with industry regulations and standards.    - Continuous Improvement: Continuously evaluate and improve technology processes, procedures, and systems to ensure that they are effective, efficient, and aligned with the organization's goals.    - Communication: Communicate technology plans, decisions, and results to senior management and other stakeholders.      Essential Skills for an IT Manager:      - Technical Expertise: A deep understanding of technology, including hardware, software, and network systems, is critical for an IT Manager to effectively manage technology resources.- Leadership: An IT Manager must be a strong leader, able to motivate and mentor technology staff and effectively communicate with senior management and other    stakeholders.    - Strategic Thinking: The ability to develop and implement technology strategies that align with the overall goals of the organization is essential for an IT Manager.    - Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills are critical for an IT Manager, who must communicate complex technical information to non-technical stakeholders and negotiate contracts with technology vendors.    - Budgeting and Financial Management: An IT Manager must be able to develop and manage the technology budget, ensuring that technology investments are aligned with the organization's overall financial objectives.    - Problem Solving: The ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical problems is essential for an IT Manager, who must ensure the availability and security of the organization's technology infrastructure and data.    - Change/Procurement Management: An IT Manager must be able to effectively manage change, whether it is implementing new technology systems or adapting to changes in the technology landscape.    - Adaptability: The technology landscape is constantly evolving, and an IT Manager must be able to quickly adapt to new technologies and changing business requirements.    - Customer/Client Focus: An IT Manager must have a customer-focused approach, ensuring that technology solutions meet the needs of the organization's stakeholders and deliver value to the business.      Technical Skills:      - Network administration: Knowledge of local and wide area networks, firewalls, network security protocols, and routing and switching protocols.    - Cloud computing: Understanding of cloud computing technologies, including public, private, and hybrid clouds, as well as knowledge of cloud security best practices.    - Database management: Familiarity with database management systems, data warehousing, and data analytics.    - Cybersecurity: Understanding of cybersecurity risks, threats, and best practices for securing networks, systems, and data.    - Information technology infrastructure library (ITIL): Knowledge of ITIL framework for managing IT services and operations.    - Business continuity and disaster recovery: Understanding of best practices for ensuring business continuity and disaster recovery in the event of a technology failure.    - Vendor management: Knowledge of how to evaluate, negotiate with, and manage relationships with technology vendors and contractors.    - Communication and leadership: Strong written and verbal communication skills, as well as leadership skills to manage and motivate a team of technology professionals.      Good to have:      - Software development: Understanding of software development lifecycles, programming languages, and software testing methodologies.
